publicationStmt.p: This is an XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.

sourceDesc.bibl: Linkui tsi stiki Bautista Ramírez, Verónica; Beckmann, Gisela Gómez Hernández, María. 2008. (2nd ed.). Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C. Tlalpan, D.F., México Obtained from:

abstract.ab: Hubo un sapo que quería ser tan grande como el toro y tomó mucha agua para crecer. De tanta que tomó, su barriga le explotó y el toro lo lamentó.

textDesc.channel: @mode:'w' means that the primary means of utilising this document is by reading it's written form;
textDesc.derivation: this document is labeled "original" because the XML-TEI markup of it's contents have not made any alterations to the original content;

normalization.ab: 2018-02-19Spelling of lexical items which in the old orthography were homographs and which have been changed according to updated orthographic principles as per ../Mille/GUIA_ORTOGRAFICA_PRELIMINAR_Short_version.xml. Instances of "ña" still remain to be changed pending consultation with Mille (or other person working on orthography). In this document the extended senses of "face" - "nuu" were not normalized as I am awaiting discussion as to whether this particular sense should also be changed to "nu".

list.item: Mixtec content found at following locations: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg/w

English translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span[@xml:lang='en'] the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalentwhere a preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

Spanish translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span[@xml:lang='es'] the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalent where a preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

spanGrp.span: One day a frog was sitting on the bank of a river because it was very cold.
Un día un sapo se sentaba en la orilla de un río porque hacía muy frío.
(Check with speakers) this is an example of the relativizer being attached to a verb to make a relative verb phrase "ña-". This is a prefix here
is this different from the item in "know"?
When it was five in the morning it got up and croaked.
Cuando eran las cinco en la mañana se levantó y croó.
is this verb specific to a frog? Get other forms
Then a bull arrived at the lake because it was going to go eat (?).
Y llegó un toro porque él iba a comer (?)
Then it saw where the frog was sitting where it was shivering where it was laying, it was very cold because the water was very cold, it was sitting in the sun in order to warm up it's back.
Y vió donde se sentaba y temblaba el sapo porque era muy frío porque el agua era muy frío, se sentaba en el sol para calentarse su espalda.
check with speakers, is this a variant verb form or a combination with relativizer?!
check with speakers on "ña-" here too.
Then the bull said the following:
Y el toro dijó el siguente:
No me voy en alguna parte.
It sat down on the river bank to see the toad that was shivering.
Se sentó al orilla del río para ver el sapo que temblava.
this is inflected for 3pers of lemma "kunche'e" (is "kunchee" a variant?)
compare to 1st instance, why was ther "nui" therein?
What is it that you eat that you are so big?
¿Qué cosa comes para ser así grande?
this is a predicating adjective (unless the "tuu" is a copular adverb)
Then the bull said the following:
Y el toro dijó el siguente:
I eat what is harvested, weeds and grass and then I drink a lot of water.
Lo que como lo que es cochestado, las malas hierbas y hierba, y bebo mucha agua.
this could be put in the dictionary as a related entry to "kua'a" or "xeen"
Then the frog (thought/said to himself?) the following:
Y el sapo se pensó el siguente:
Let's drink a lot of water so that I can get big like the bull, and so he said the following:
Why are you so big? when I passed by the river you were so small.
Porqué estas tan grande? cuando pasé por el río estabas tan chiquito.
is this 'you are so big'? are the "uu" inflected for 2pers?
Then the frog was very happy, got up and hopped off.
Y el sapo estaba muy feliz, se levantó y salió saltando.
copular adj phrase? this isn't inflected since the subject/actor is following explicitly.
Then he came to the river bed and then leaned from a rock and started to drink water.
Y vinó al orilla del río y se inclinó de una piedra y empezó a beber agua.
He drank so much that his stomach was filled with water.
Bibió tanto que su estómago estaba lleno de agua.
in this context it means "so much that"
is this the same verb as "finished"? get other used of this item
this is interesting because it itflected for 3sg with "-a"
Then he got back up and sat back down on the other side of the river bed.
Y se levantó y se sentó al otro lado del orilla del río.
Then something bad began to happen to his stomach, he then got up and ran.
Y algo malo empezó a passar en su estómago y se levantó corriendo.
And then he though to himself:
Now I must run so that my stomach feels better.
Ahora debo correr para que el estómago senta mejor.
get some other instances of this verb used.
Then when he went to run
su pansa explodó como un kuete.
Tisu is sure this item should be "nikan'ti"; check with other speakers.
The bull heard so it ran over and said:
El toro oí entonces corrió y dijó:
Tisu says this should be "niki'ni"; check with other speakers.

Not sure how this should be treated lexicographically, it's likely not an expression that is relevant outside of spontaneous usage..(Ask speakers if "sketa sketa" means 'hop' specifically as applied to rabbits and frogs.)
And when he opened his eyes he saw that the frog's stomach had exploded.
Y cuando abrió sus ojos, vió que el estómago del sapo explotó.
"nta-" is inchoative. Is this verb specifically used for opening eyes? (Ask speakers)
Then the bull said the following:
Y el toro dijó el siguente:
It was bad that the frog wanted to get big like me because of the problems that it caused him.
Era malo que el sapo quiería devenir grande como yo dado todos las problemas que le passaron.
would to make something bigger be: "sa-ntu-ka'nu"?
Then the bull began to cry because the frog died.
Y el toro empezó a llorar porque el sapo murió
Then it picked up the frog and went to bury it in the ground.
Y recogió el sapo y se fue a enterrarlo en la tierra.
If we come back to eat grass here, it's going to smell bad, it's better to bury him.
Se volvamos aquí a comer pasto, va a pestar mal, es mejor enterrarlo.
